wikipedia_page.main: William Philip Gislingham (About 1874 London, England – 31 Dec 1957 London, Middlesex, England) was a British music hall musician and  acrobat (part of the Famous Kellinos) and, using the name W. P. Kellino, film director.he founded Twickenham Studios. He was the father of the cinematographer Roy Kellino.

response: He later joined the repertory group of the Oxford Playhouse theater and began touring with various companies and was involved in some seasons in regional theater, being featured in 14 British films, including The Poisoned Diamond (1933), directed by W. P. Kellino; Norah O'Neale (1934), directed by Brian Desmond Hurst; Regal Cavalcade (1935); and The Girl in the Crowd (1935), directed by Michael Powell.

Category:Films directed by W. P. Kellino

With fellow music hall performer Charles Austin, he set up Homeland Films, and made several silent short films, including Billy's Spanish Love Spasm (1915), directed by W. P. Kellino. Rachael Low (ed.), The History of British Film 1914 - 1918 · Volume 3, Taylor & Francis, 2013, p.99  He also appeared in three films made in the DeForest Phonofilm sound-on-film process, Billy Merson Sings Desdemona, Billy Merson Sings Scotland's Whiskey (a satire on Sir Harry Lauder), and Billy Merson in a Russian Opera (all 1926-1927).
